18e9987a22271c34.body:
3/31 game vs Atlanta Braves
The Phillies fate seemed to be destined for a season starting sweep against the Braves….but luckily a 5-4 win yesterday got us our first win of the season instead…Ranger Suarez started his first game of the year…pitched 5 innings allowing 3 earned runs…classic early season stat line for Ranger…Strahm and Hoffman both pitched scoreless innings, Dominguez ran into trouble in the 8th allowing a run, Soto got him out of it…Alvarado closed out the game in the 9th…the Phillies scoring started with a lead off Schwarber home run, his first of the season…Schwarber also had a fielders choice RBI in the 5th…in the 7th Trea Turner hit an RBI single and Alex Bohm hit in a pair of runs on a single…first win im the books…
Record: 1-2
Standings: Tied for 2nd in NL East
Next up: Monday 4/1 @ 6:40 vs CIN Ress
On Sun, Mar 31, 2024 at 11:05 AM Peter Donato <

> wrote:

18e950bac2969fd5.body:
3/30 game vs Atlanta Braves
The people spoke and I’m keeping this a single chain…the Phillies dropped the second game of the season yesterday by a score of 12-4…Aaron Nola got the start and had a pretty awful game…pitching 4.1 innings and allowing 7 earned runs in the first three…the Phillies scored 3 runs in the first inning thanks to terrible pitching from Atlanta’s Max Fried and also thanks to a two run single from Stott…in the fourth JT Realmuto hit a bomb to make it a 7-4 game…Luis Ortiz relieved Nola in the fifth…Ortiz continued to pitch in the 6th but allowed 3 earned runs and got injured (not sure the details of the injury)…SerAnthony Dominguez took over in the sixth and allowed another 2 runs…Marte and Soto pitched scoreless 7th and 8th innings…Brogdon pitched the 9th and allowed a final home run…final score of 12-4…disappointing game of pitching from the Fightins….
Record: 0-2
Standings: Tied for 3rd in NL East
Next up: Sunday 3/31 @ 1:35 vs ATL Braves
On Sat, Mar 30, 2024 at 8:49 AM Peter Donato <

> wrote:

18e8f68900113ea8.body:
3/29 game vs Atlanta Braves
Welcome back folks, Phillies opening day was finally upon us yesterday…excited to be back…excited to be hurt again….I’m sure the season will be have it’s typical moments…Bryce coming up huge, Wheeler being an ace, Ben Davis being insufferable in the broadcasting booth, etc….but I’m sure we’ll also have some surprises (I recently heard newsletter favorite Ranger Suarez projected to be a Cy Young candidate by the end of the year)…huge if true…
Yesterday the Phillies lost the opening day game 9-3 to the Braves…Zach Wheeler had an outstanding start pitching 6 scoreless innings… in the 5th Brandon Marsh hit a 2 run homer to put the Phillies up 2-0…exciting moment…unfortunately the Phillies bullpen that came into relieve Wheels didn’t have the “best ranked bullpen in the MLB” stuff we were expecting…Strahm pitched in the 7th and gave up 2 runs…Hoffman relieved Strahm and got out of the inning…Alvarado had a terrible 8th giving up 5 runs…Brogdon relieved Alvarado and gave up another couple runs…giving the Braves a 9-2 lead…Phillies tacked on a run in the bottom of the 9th via a Casty RBI single…Yunior Marte pitched a scoreless 9th and the Phillies couldn’t mount any semblance of a comeback in the final half inning…final score of 9-3…disappointing opening day….
Something to consider though:
https://x.com/blakeifox/status/1773836607323361578?s=46&t=r0VQH_pUQ5r11aSSkRreIw
Final thoughts…not sure if I’ll rely to this and this will be our chain for the year…or if it’ll be a new email each day…I also can’t figure out how to make a distro list in gmail…I’ve spent the majority of a train ride to Philly trying to figure it out and it’s beyond me…if you know how to do this please reach out….
Record: 0-1
Standings: Tied for 2nd in NL East
Next up: Saturday 3/30 @ 4:05 vs ATL Braves
